markdownRemark.html:
At Sāvatthī.

“Mendicants, I will teach you about the gods of the clouds. Listen …

And what are the gods of the clouds? There are gods of the cool clouds, warm clouds, thunder clouds, windy clouds, and rainy clouds. These are called the gods of the clouds.”

SN.32.2. Sucaritasutta (“Good Conduct”)

children.value:
“Mendicants, I will teach you about the gods of the clouds.
Listen …

And what are the gods of the clouds?
There are gods of the cool clouds,
warm clouds,
thunder clouds,
windy clouds,
and rainy clouds.
These are called the gods of the clouds.”
